subject: Re: FW: Commweb and 3DS 2.0
preview: Thanks for the update Sean. CommBank didn't find any issues with our code, it looks like we were given production credentials when they had only setup the account with test credentials. I have just e

full_threads.body:
Thanks for the update Sean. 

CommBank didn't find any issues with our code, it looks like we were given production credentials when they had only setup the account with test credentials. I have just emailed them back and cc'd you guys in asking for the actual password. 

I'll keep you posted.

Hi Heath

CBA advised me of a delay of 3D Secure 2.0 by Mastercard leading into December and Visa leading into next year.

We won't be able to consider alternatives now until the new year anyway. I had a brief look at stripe who still have chargebacks for disputed transactions. The whole idea of using 3D Secure 2.0 with CBA was to avoid this.

Anyway this leaves us in limbo for a while so not much we can do.

I'll round up everyone again when we have more information from CBA.

Thank you

Regards,

Sean Diamond

Purchasing & Systems Manager

NICK'S RESTAURANT & BAR GROUP

Suite 125/158-166 Day Street, Sydney NSW 2000

E sean@nicksgroup.com.au W http://www.nicksgroup.com.au/

This is the sample response we are getting: 

{"cause":"INVALID_REQUEST","explanation":"Invalid request","supportCode":"DLX47V2LWGZNH","result":"ERROR"}

Hello Heath,

Based on our initial investigation, we cannot see test transaction logs for this MID TESTNICSEACOM201 in our payment gateway.

Can you please share with us the API request and response logs that you submitted to our payment gateway for further analysis?

Please do not hesitate to contact us with any further questions.

Case Information

Case Number: 20191117-135653

Case Details: FW: FW: Commweb and 3DS 2.0

Kind Regards,

William

Commweb Support
Phone: 1800 230 177 (Option 1,3,3)
E-mail: +commweb@cba.com.au

Confidentiality Note: The information contained in this email and any attachments is confidential and/or privileged. This email and any attachments are intended to be read only by the person named above. If the reader of this email and any attachments is not the intended recipient, or a representative of the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any review, dissemination or copying of this email and any attachments is prohibited. If you have received this email and any attachments in error, please notify the sender by email, telephone or fax and return it to the sender at the email address above.

[ CBA Information Classification: Customer and Personal ]

Hi Sean,

Hope you had a great weekend!

I just left you a message on your mobile.

The last correspondence I have with Heath was for him to contact the Helpdesk as the issue was technical and they are the best team to look after this especially with integration matters. The Helpdesk is more than equipped to assist as they can actually see what is happening.

The last contact from your end to the technical team was from Natasha asking for assistance with API credentials and that was resolved hence she was able to add Heath/WPPerk as user.

Heath -William from our technical team will contact you directly and will assist you with the errors but he needs more information from you. Are you able to provide your direct number ? From the email trail, I only have your email address. Case number for this is 20191117-135653. The Commweb Technical team's number is 1800 882 888( option, 1,3,3) and provide the merchant ID.

Happy to jump into a conference call with our technical team and WPPerk if required. I am free until 2pm today. Let me know what suits.

Thank you.

Hi Heath

Thanks for getting back to me on this. I see Joe Kam replied to us this morning too. If you wouldn't mind explaining to him what you are going through then I will follow up with him again.

It seems if we don't get anywhere we will have no choice than to look at other options. Do you have a contact at Stripe you can send me?

Thanks

Regards,

Sean Diamond

Purchasing & Systems Manager

NICK'S RESTAURANT & BAR GROUP

Suite 125/158-166 Day Street, Sydney NSW 2000

E sean@nicksgroup.com.au W http://www.nicksgroup.com.au/

Hi Joe

Thanks for getting back to me on this. I'll leave Heath to explain the issues he is having with the helpdesk.

From our end though it seems no-one is spearheading this from CBA. Simply referring to the helpdesk is not getting us anywhere. If someone can't see this through then I'm afraid we will have no choice but to look at other options. We have just had 2 chargebacks of $605 and $1005 from fraudulent use in purchasing our gift cards online.

Please let me know how you go.

Thank you

Regards,

Sean Diamond

Purchasing & Systems Manager

NICK'S RESTAURANT & BAR GROUP

Suite 125/158-166 Day Street, Sydney NSW 2000

E sean@nicksgroup.com.au W http://www.nicksgroup.com.au/

Hi Sean,

Thanks for your email.

After going through the email below we are still awaiting a response from Heath regarding the set up.

Heath, are you able to advise if you were able to contact the help desk?

Regards,

Joe Kam
Relationship Executive
Mobile: 0459 881 724

Hi Sean, 

Thanks for checking in. We have been working on it, and have set it up as per the CommBank documentation. Each time we ask any specific questions we are simply referred back to it as they don't have any technical knowledge. I'm even sceptical that the account has been configured correctly at their end and we have little to ways to debug and audit.

So the next step is to get on the phone and hope the CommBank tech support can pin point issue, be it in the code or the account setup. I'm the one 'dragging the chain' from that perspective as it will take a fair bit of my time to get on the phone and explain the acute details etc. I will also point out that the 3D secure was only activated last month. I plan to do this next week as I have been booked up solid on existing confirmed projects. 

I will reiterate again that they are solutions such as Stripe that we can deploy in approx 15mins and do so every second day or so. Stripe does the heavy lifting and the funds flow through to your nominated bank account less the transaction fee. These too have leading security features, robust APIs and useful dashboards for both development and accounting purposes. I understand the per transaction fee may be a little higher, however, other costs such as this recent case and resources (internal and external) do add up to a compelling proposition. I'm not trying to take the easy route by any means, but, I know what you guys are missing out on and have been through this with the big 4 banks a few times. One has even told me that they simply can't keep pace with the likes of Stripe. The things that are within our control, we are rapidly deploying for you guys. Rest assured we want this completed ASAP as well. 

Hope that gives you some clarity and I'll be in touch.

Hi Mary & Heath

Can you please advise where we are up to with this.

We have just fallen victim to another fraud case on some gift card sales that CBA have charged back as usual.

We have been waiting months to get this integration fixed and now it is costing us.

Please let me know ASAP where we are at and who is dragging the chain on this.

Thank you

Regards,

Sean Diamond

Purchasing & Systems Manager

NICK'S RESTAURANT & BAR GROUP

Suite 125/158-166 Day Street, Sydney NSW 2000

E sean@nicksgroup.com.au W http://www.nicksgroup.com.au/

Hi Mary and CBA team, 

We have been working on integrating the 3DS 2.0 with the nicksgroup.com.au website. 

We keep getting an error message of "Invalid request" and are hoping you can provide some more detailed insights? 

  • The page we have added the CBA checkout to is: https://staging-nicksnew.kinsta.com/deposits/
  • We have attached a screen shot of the error message "screen-shot-invalid-request.png"
  • The script we are using is also attached "nicksgroup-3ds-scripts.txt"
Please let us know your thoughts?

No problem at all thank you Heath

Natasha Kouts | Marketing & Graphic Design Manager
